span.span: The source of the event, the control.

summary.span: 表示将处理 控件的 、、 和 事件的方法。

span.span: Represents the method that will handle the , , , and events of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 创建 委托时，需要标识将要处理该事件的方法。When you create an delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. 若要将事件与事件处理程序关联，请将该委托的一个实例添加到事件中。To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. 除非移除了该委托，否则每当发生该事件时就会调用事件处理程序。The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. 有关如何处理事件的详细信息，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about how to handle events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用控件与业务对象和一个控件中删除数据。The following code example demonstrates how to use an control with a business object and a control to delete data. 最初显示的所有员工，使用指定的方法的一组属性来检索从数据`EmployeeLogic`对象。The initially displays a set of all employees, using the method that is specified by the property to retrieve the data from the `EmployeeLogic` object. 因为属性设置为`true`，则控件自动显示**删除**按钮。Because the property is set to `true`, the control automatically displays a **Delete** button. 如果单击**删除**按钮，使用指定的方法执行操作属性，在中指定任何参数集合。If you click the **Delete** button, the action is performed using the method that is specified by the property and any parameters that are specified in the collection. 在此代码示例中，还执行一些预处理和后处理步骤。In this code example, some preprocessing and post-processing steps are also performed. `NorthwindEmployeeDeleting`委托调用以处理事件之前执行操作，和`NorthwindEmployeeDeleted`委托调用以处理事件之后操作完成后，若要执行异常处理。The `NorthwindEmployeeDeleting` delegate is called to handle the event before the action is performed, and the `NorthwindEmployeeDeleted` delegate is called to handle the event after the action has completed, to perform exception handling. 在此示例中，如果`NorthwindDataException`是抛出，它由处理此委托。In this example, if a `NorthwindDataException` is thrown, it is handled by this delegate. 若要检查的实现`EmployeeLogic`中间层业务对象，它将使用此代码示例，请参阅中的类概述。To examine the implementation of the `EmployeeLogic` middle-tier business object that this code example uses, see the class overview in .
